metadata.name: Cyberpunk Generator
metadata.author: Rolldeo
metadata.description: A **cyberpunk** generator for creating NPCs, corporations, gangs, gigs, locations, cyberware, and street scenes. Perfect for any neon-soaked dystopian future setting where megacorps rule the world and chrome is king.

tables.name: Megacorporations
tables.description: The massive corporate entities that control the world

entries.description: Japanese megacorp specializing in security and banking

tables.name: Street Gangs
tables.description: The gangs that control the streets

entries.description: Latino gang with strong family ties
Nomad family operating near the city

sets.danger: low for corps, extreme for intruders
low inside, high trying to enter

entries.value: Neon signs flicker and buzz, casting shifting shadows in primary colors.
The bass from hidden speakers makes your chest vibrate.
Steam rises from grates, mixing with the ever-present smog.
Holographic advertisements assault your senses from every surface.
The acrid smell of synthetic food and recycled air fills your nostrils.
Conversations in a dozen languages create a constant murmur.
Security drones hum overhead, red lights scanning the crowd.
The metallic tang of blood and chrome hangs in the air.
Rain patters against grimy windows, neon reflections pooling in the gutters.
Warning klaxons echo from somewhere distant, but no one reacts.
The sharp ozone smell of recently fired weapons lingers.
Glitching AR overlays compete for your attention.
covered in gang tattoos and chrome piercings
wearing a battered leather jacket with too many patches
sporting neon hair and glowing subdermal implants
hidden under layers of patched hoodies and scarves
dressed in practical work clothes, stained with grease
decked out in garish colors and excessive accessories
wearing minimal clothing to show off extensive chrome
dressed in dark, anonymous clothing to avoid attention
impeccably dressed in designer suit, not a hair out of place
wearing smart-fabric that shifts colors subtly
sporting augmented reality glasses and subtle earpiece
dressed in tactical corporate security uniform
wearing lab coat over expensive casual wear
in a crisp uniform with corporate logo prominently displayed
wearing obviously expensive clothes that scream wealth
dressed conservatively but with subtle quality indicators
hands that shake slightly from stim abuse
an unsettling lack of visible humanity
one eye, now replaced with chrome
mismatched eyes - one organic, one chrome
spine visible through transparent back panel
completely absent, replaced with chrome plating
a cyberleg with a slight hitch
unnaturally smooth movements from full body replacement
old war wound that never healed right
swagger that says they own the street
speaks in short, clipped sentences, always scanning for threats
radiates false warmth while calculating angles
carries themselves with quiet, dangerous confidence
twitchy and fast-talking, probably on stims
eerily calm, emotion seemingly edited out
laughs at inappropriate moments, maybe too much chrome
world-weary and cynical, seen too much
idealistic despite everything, still believes in something
aggressive and confrontational, looking for a fight
smooth talker who could sell ice to a polar bear
quiet and observant, speaks only when necessary
jovial and friendly, but eyes stay hard
wants revenge on the corpo who ruined their life
needs money desperately for someone's medical treatment
trying to buy their way out of the combat zone
searching for a family member who disappeared
wants to bring down the system from inside
just trying to survive another day
saving up to get off-world, start fresh
proving themselves to a gang for membership
paying off a massive debt to the wrong people
gathering evidence to expose corporate crimes
hunting the person who killed someone they loved
wants to become legendary, remembered forever

tables.name: Gig Types
tables.description: Types of jobs available on the street

entries.description: Get someone out of somewhere they don't want to be
Steal information from a secured system
Keep someone alive who has enemies
Move something from A to B, no questions
Get someone from here to there safely
Find out the truth about something
Convince someone to do something they don't want to
Make a problem disappear, no traces

entries.value: The target is not who or what you were told.
Another crew is running the same job.
Your employer is setting you up.
Security is much heavier than expected.
A gang claims this is their territory.
Innocent people are in the line of fire.
The job is personal for someone on the team.
Local law enforcement has been tipped off.
The extraction target doesn't want to leave.
A netrunner is actively opposing you.
The real objective was never explained.
a fixer you've worked with before
a gang leader needing outside help
a desperate civilian with nowhere else to turn
a rival merc crew needing backup
a ripperdoc who needs something acquired
an AI that somehow made contact
Acid rain falls steadily, eating at exposed metal and skin.
Toxic smog blankets everything, requiring filters to breathe.
Clear skies, if you can call the permanent gray haze clear.
Heavy fog rolls in from the industrial zones.
Unseasonably hot, the heat island effect in full force.
Electromagnetic storm causes AR glitches everywhere.
Light drizzle, neon lights reflecting beautifully in puddles.
Wind howls between the towers, carrying garbage and despair.
BREAKING: {{megaCorporations}} Stock Plunges After Data Breach
Combat Zone Violence Claims {{dice:2d6+5}} Lives Overnight
New Drug Sweeping Streets, Authorities Powerless
Corporate Merger Creates New Megacorp, Thousands Laid Off
Mysterious Net Blackout Affects Entire District
Cyberpsycho Attack Leaves {{dice:1d6+2}} Dead at Mall
Mayor Denies Corruption Allegations, Points to Success Metrics
Traffic Advisory: Nomad Convoy Blocking Highway 101
Corporate War Heats Up: Militech vs Arasaka Skirmish Reported
Word is {{streetGangs}} is recruiting hard. Something big coming.
Heard there's a rogue AI living in the old net infrastructure.
{{megaCorporations}} is testing something new in the combat zone. Something bad.
A fixer got flatlined last week. The jobs they had are up for grabs.
Someone found a pre-war bunker in the badlands. Full of tech.
NCPD's been bought out by {{megaCorporations}}. More than usual, I mean.
There's a new drug on the streets. Makes black lace look like aspirin.
That ripperdoc on 5th? Scav connection. Watch yourself.
The mayor's got a body double. Real one's been dead for months.
Orbital's got a secret project. Satellite weapons, maybe.
Someone's offering big eddies for info on a certain merc crew.
The net's been weird lately. Echoes of something old waking up.
A dying stranger presses a data chip into your hand. "Keep it safe. They're coming."
Your fixer hasn't been seen in three days. Their last job was for {{megaCorporations}}.
An old crew member shows up, desperate. They need help with something they can't explain.
Someone's been watching your apartment. Corporate surveillance or something worse?
A client offers triple rates for a simple delivery. Too good to be true.
You wake up with {{dice:1d6}} hours missing from your memory and blood on your hands.
A child approaches you on the street. "Jordan sent me. They need help."
Your cyberware starts glitching, showing you glimpses of something else.
A notorious gang leader wants a private meeting. No weapons, no backup.
An anonymous tip leads to evidence that could bring down a megacorp.
Someone's taken out a contract on you. You don't know why.
The news reports your death. Someone's erasing you from the system.
